abstract: Surge in ranks of Asian-American officers in the New York City Police Department has been little noticed, but shooting of Officer Wenjian Liu and other incidents of violence against Asian officers have shown how they are now on frontlines; 2,100 Asian-American officers are in uniform today, rise from 200 officers on force twenty-five years ago; risk to Asian-American segment of police population has increased as they have been assigned to all precincts, instead of just those with large Asian-American communities.
lead_paragraph: Asian-American officers have recently been in the middle of a series of wrenching incidents involving the New York Police Department, testifying to a surge in their ranks.
snippet: Asian-American officers have recently been in the middle of a series of wrenching incidents involving the New York Police Department, testifying to a surge in their ranks.

headline.main: In New York City, a Toll Is Newly Felt as Asians Rise in the Police Ranks
headline.print_headline: Toll Newly Felt as Asians Rise in Police Ranks
